00001 #!/usr/bin/env python

00007 """Make the format of a vcproj really pretty.
00008 
00009    This script normalize and sort an xml. It also fetches all the properties
00010    inside linked vsprops and include them explicitly in the vcproj.
00011 
00012    It outputs the resulting xml to stdout.
00013 """
00014 
00015 __author__ = 'nsylvain (Nicolas Sylvain)'
00016 
00017 import os
00018 import sys
00019 
00020 from xml.dom.minidom import parse
00021 from xml.dom.minidom import Node
00022 
00023 REPLACEMENTS = dict()
00024 ARGUMENTS = None
00025 
00026 
00027 class CmpTuple(object):
00028   """Compare function between 2 tuple."""
00029   def __call__(self, x, y):
00030     return cmp(x[0], y[0])
00031 
00032 
00033 class CmpNode(object):
00034   """Compare function between 2 xml nodes."""
00035 
00036   def __call__(self, x, y):
00037     def get_string(node):
00038       node_string = "node"
00039       node_string += node.nodeName
00040       if node.nodeValue:
00041         node_string += node.nodeValue
00042 
00043       if node.attributes:
00044         # We first sort by name, if present.
00045         node_string += node.getAttribute("Name")
00046 
00047         all_nodes = []
00048         for (name, value) in node.attributes.items():
00049           all_nodes.append((name, value))
00050 
00051         all_nodes.sort(CmpTuple())
00052         for (name, value) in all_nodes:
00053           node_string += name
00054           node_string += value
00055 
00056       return node_string
00057 
00058     return cmp(get_string(x), get_string(y))
00059 
00060 
00061 def PrettyPrintNode(node, indent=0):
00062   if node.nodeType == Node.TEXT_NODE:
00063     if node.data.strip():
00064       print '%s%s' % (' '*indent, node.data.strip())
00065     return
00066 
00067   if node.childNodes:
00068     node.normalize()
00069   # Get the number of attributes
00070   attr_count = 0
00071   if node.attributes:
00072     attr_count = node.attributes.length
00073 
00074   # Print the main tag
00075   if attr_count == 0:
00076     print '%s<%s>' % (' '*indent, node.nodeName)
00077   else:
00078     print '%s<%s' % (' '*indent, node.nodeName)
00079 
00080     all_attributes = []
00081     for (name, value) in node.attributes.items():
00082       all_attributes.append((name, value))
00083       all_attributes.sort(CmpTuple())
00084     for (name, value) in all_attributes:
00085       print '%s  %s="%s"' % (' '*indent, name, value)
00086     print '%s>' % (' '*indent)
00087   if node.nodeValue:
00088     print '%s  %s' % (' '*indent, node.nodeValue)
00089 
00090   for sub_node in node.childNodes:
00091     PrettyPrintNode(sub_node, indent=indent+2)
00092   print '%s</%s>' % (' '*indent, node.nodeName)
00093 
00094 
00095 def FlattenFilter(node):
00096   """Returns a list of all the node and sub nodes."""
00097   node_list = []
00098 
00099   if (node.attributes and
00100       node.getAttribute('Name') == '_excluded_files'):
00101       # We don't add the "_excluded_files" filter.
00102     return []
00103 
00104   for current in node.childNodes:
00105     if current.nodeName == 'Filter':
00106       node_list.extend(FlattenFilter(current))
00107     else:
00108       node_list.append(current)
00109 
00110   return node_list
00111 
00112 
00113 def FixFilenames(filenames, current_directory):
00114   new_list = []
00115   for filename in filenames:
00116     if filename:
00117       for key in REPLACEMENTS:
00118         filename = filename.replace(key, REPLACEMENTS[key])
00119       os.chdir(current_directory)
00120       filename = filename.strip('"\' ')
00121       if filename.startswith('$'):
00122         new_list.append(filename)
00123       else:
00124         new_list.append(os.path.abspath(filename))
00125   return new_list
00126 
00127 
00128 def AbsoluteNode(node):
00129   """Makes all the properties we know about in this node absolute."""
00130   if node.attributes:
00131     for (name, value) in node.attributes.items():
00132       if name in ['InheritedPropertySheets', 'RelativePath',
00133                   'AdditionalIncludeDirectories',
00134                   'IntermediateDirectory', 'OutputDirectory',
00135                   'AdditionalLibraryDirectories']:
00136         # We want to fix up these paths
00137         path_list = value.split(';')
00138         new_list = FixFilenames(path_list, os.path.dirname(ARGUMENTS[1]))
00139         node.setAttribute(name, ';'.join(new_list))
00140       if not value:
00141         node.removeAttribute(name)
00142 
00143 
00144 def CleanupVcproj(node):
00145   """For each sub node, we call recursively this function."""
00146   for sub_node in node.childNodes:
00147     AbsoluteNode(sub_node)
00148     CleanupVcproj(sub_node)
00149 
00150   # Normalize the node, and remove all extranous whitespaces.
00151   for sub_node in node.childNodes:
00152     if sub_node.nodeType == Node.TEXT_NODE:
00153       sub_node.data = sub_node.data.replace("\r", "")
00154       sub_node.data = sub_node.data.replace("\n", "")
00155       sub_node.data = sub_node.data.rstrip()
00156 
00157   # Fix all the semicolon separated attributes to be sorted, and we also
00158   # remove the dups.
00159   if node.attributes:
00160     for (name, value) in node.attributes.items():
00161       sorted_list = sorted(value.split(';'))
00162       unique_list = []
00163       for i in sorted_list:
00164         if not unique_list.count(i):
00165           unique_list.append(i)
00166       node.setAttribute(name, ';'.join(unique_list))
00167       if not value:
00168         node.removeAttribute(name)
00169 
00170   if node.childNodes:
00171     node.normalize()
00172 
00173   # For each node, take a copy, and remove it from the list.
00174   node_array = []
00175   while node.childNodes and node.childNodes[0]:
00176     # Take a copy of the node and remove it from the list.
00177     current = node.childNodes[0]
00178     node.removeChild(current)
00179 
00180     # If the child is a filter, we want to append all its children
00181     # to this same list.
00182     if current.nodeName == 'Filter':
00183       node_array.extend(FlattenFilter(current))
00184     else:
00185       node_array.append(current)
00186 
00187 
00188   # Sort the list.
00189   node_array.sort(CmpNode())
00190 
00191   # Insert the nodes in the correct order.
00192   for new_node in node_array:
00193     # But don't append empty tool node.
00194     if new_node.nodeName == 'Tool':
00195       if new_node.attributes and new_node.attributes.length == 1:
00196         # This one was empty.
00197         continue
00198     if new_node.nodeName == 'UserMacro':
00199       continue
00200     node.appendChild(new_node)
00201 
00202 
00203 def GetConfiguationNodes(vcproj):
00204   #TODO(nsylvain): Find a better way to navigate the xml.
00205   nodes = []
00206   for node in vcproj.childNodes:
00207     if node.nodeName == "Configurations":
00208       for sub_node in node.childNodes:
00209         if sub_node.nodeName == "Configuration":
00210           nodes.append(sub_node)
00211 
00212   return nodes
00213 
00214 
00215 def GetChildrenVsprops(filename):
00216   dom = parse(filename)
00217   if dom.documentElement.attributes:
00218     vsprops = dom.documentElement.getAttribute('InheritedPropertySheets')
00219     return FixFilenames(vsprops.split(';'), os.path.dirname(filename))
00220   return []
00221 
00222 def SeekToNode(node1, child2):
00223   # A text node does not have properties.
00224   if child2.nodeType == Node.TEXT_NODE:
00225     return None
00226 
00227   # Get the name of the current node.
00228   current_name = child2.getAttribute("Name")
00229   if not current_name:
00230     # There is no name. We don't know how to merge.
00231     return None
00232 
00233   # Look through all the nodes to find a match.
00234   for sub_node in node1.childNodes:
00235     if sub_node.nodeName == child2.nodeName:
00236       name = sub_node.getAttribute("Name")
00237       if name == current_name:
00238         return sub_node
00239 
00240   # No match. We give up.
00241   return None
00242 
00243 
00244 def MergeAttributes(node1, node2):
00245   # No attributes to merge?
00246   if not node2.attributes:
00247     return
00248 
00249   for (name, value2) in node2.attributes.items():
00250     # Don't merge the 'Name' attribute.
00251     if name == 'Name':
00252       continue
00253     value1 = node1.getAttribute(name)
00254     if value1:
00255       # The attribute exist in the main node. If it's equal, we leave it
00256       # untouched, otherwise we concatenate it.
00257       if value1 != value2:
00258         node1.setAttribute(name, ';'.join([value1, value2]))
00259     else:
00260       # The attribute does nto exist in the main node. We append this one.
00261       node1.setAttribute(name, value2)
00262 
00263     # If the attribute was a property sheet attributes, we remove it, since
00264     # they are useless.
00265     if name == 'InheritedPropertySheets':
00266       node1.removeAttribute(name)
00267 
00268 
00269 def MergeProperties(node1, node2):
00270   MergeAttributes(node1, node2)
00271   for child2 in node2.childNodes:
00272     child1 = SeekToNode(node1, child2)
00273     if child1:
00274       MergeProperties(child1, child2)
00275     else:
00276       node1.appendChild(child2.cloneNode(True))
00277 
00278 
00279 def main(argv):
00280   """Main function of this vcproj prettifier."""
00281   global ARGUMENTS
00282   ARGUMENTS = argv
00283 
00284   # check if we have exactly 1 parameter.
00285   if len(argv) < 2:
00286     print ('Usage: %s "c:\\path\\to\\vcproj.vcproj" [key1=value1] '
00287            '[key2=value2]' % argv[0])
00288     return 1
00289 
00290   # Parse the keys
00291   for i in range(2, len(argv)):
00292     (key, value) = argv[i].split('=')
00293     REPLACEMENTS[key] = value
00294 
00295   # Open the vcproj and parse the xml.
00296   dom = parse(argv[1])
00297 
00298   # First thing we need to do is find the Configuration Node and merge them
00299   # with the vsprops they include.
00300   for configuration_node in GetConfiguationNodes(dom.documentElement):
00301     # Get the property sheets associated with this configuration.
00302     vsprops = configuration_node.getAttribute('InheritedPropertySheets')
00303 
00304     # Fix the filenames to be absolute.
00305     vsprops_list = FixFilenames(vsprops.strip().split(';'),
00306                                 os.path.dirname(argv[1]))
00307 
00308     # Extend the list of vsprops with all vsprops contained in the current
00309     # vsprops.
00310     for current_vsprops in vsprops_list:
00311       vsprops_list.extend(GetChildrenVsprops(current_vsprops))
00312 
00313     # Now that we have all the vsprops, we need to merge them.
00314     for current_vsprops in vsprops_list:
00315       MergeProperties(configuration_node,
00316                       parse(current_vsprops).documentElement)
00317 
00318   # Now that everything is merged, we need to cleanup the xml.
00319   CleanupVcproj(dom.documentElement)
00320 
00321   # Finally, we use the prett xml function to print the vcproj back to the
00322   # user.
00323   #print dom.toprettyxml(newl="\n")
00324   PrettyPrintNode(dom.documentElement)
00325   return 0
00326 
00327 
00328 if __name__ == '__main__':
00329   sys.exit(main(sys.argv))
